catalog_info.title: Aesthetics of Sensationalism: Crime and Violence in Latin American Culture
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Prerequisite: Previous coursework in Spanish at the 90- or 100-level; or the permission of the course head.
catalog_info.description: Probes sensationalism as register of violent crimes and traumatic experiences in key moments of Latin American cultural history. Explores sensation as an object of knowledge: as a constructive break with or interruption of storytelling, narrative, discourse, etc. Readings and visual materials by Fernando Vallejo, Bolaño, Metinides, Moris, Kristeva, Burke, Kant, Deleuze, Adorno, Yudice, etc.
